item.description:
Castle Island 7 Miles loop is quite extraordinary because it's a well maintained and uninterrupted paved path running along Atlantic Ocean from Harbor Point to Pleasure Bay and then around Port Independence. There is a beautiful views of Ocean, Boston Harbor Islands, Boston City Skyline, and the yachts on the water. Its truly a picturesque and scenic running path that you find in such a close proximity to Boston. You may run all 7 miles or 5 miles loop.

Checkout the path on "walkjogrun" map( pl. ignore the start and end points, they are not marked correctly!).
http://www.walkjogrun...
Website Link to Carson Beach , Boston, MA
http://www.bostonharb...

Some salient features of this path:

* Close to Downtown Boston
* Mass Transit Accessible
* Drinking Water Fountains along the path
* Public Restrooms ( at Fort Independence and L Street Curley Center).
* Uninterrupted one stretch 7 miles of running!
* Cool Ocean Breeze
* Flat trail (no hills)
* Plenty of Irish Pubs (The Playwright, Beer Garden etc ) in Downtown South Boston to cool off after the run.

You may not like this path if you:
* Have seasickness.
* Don't like low flying noisy airplanes passing by every now and then.


How to get there?

300 William J Day Blvd, Boston, MA 02127
Take I-93 to Exit 15. Make a left at the light to rotary, and onto Day Boulevard and enter the first parking lot on your right hand side (Right across from Joe Moakley Park)

MBTA access:
Take Red Line to JFK/UMass. And walk to the first parking lot on William J Day Blvd on the right hand side.


Questions?
Please send me a message from my profile page, or I will be available on phone (617-767-3171) on the day of run from 4:00PM till 6:30PM (I will not have phone while running).
Weather Concerns?
Forecast of Thunderstorms, Lighetening and heavy rain for this day will cancel the event and e-mail will be sent to all signed-up members at least a day in advance.
